articles.author: Victoria Waldersee
articles.description: Volkswagen (VOWG_p.DE) has not made a decision on producing a 20,000-euro ($21,714.00) electric car yet, but Chief Executive Oliver Blume is convinced that the company can get there by the second half of the decade, he said at a conference on Wednesday.
articles.title: Volkswagen CEO: 20,000-euro EV could come in second half of decade

articles.author: Andy Bruce, William Schomberg
articles.description: British inflation cooled more than expected in October as household energy prices dropped from a year ago and there was also a wider softening of price pressures, offering relief to the Bank of England and Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.
articles.title: UK inflation slows sharply, boosting BoE and PM Sunak

articles.author: Michael Kahn, Anna Koper
articles.description: Central European defence companies are negotiating new deals to sell more weapons, military equipment and related services in Africa as they seek to poach customers looking for alternatives to Russia, companies and government officials say.
articles.title: Central Europe's defence companies spy African opportunity

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's October economic activity perked up as industrial output grew at a faster pace and retail sales growth beat expectations, an encouraging sign for an economy still showing significant pockets of weakness despite a flurry of support measures.
articles.title: China factory output, retail sales beat expectations in boost to economic recovery

articles.author: Siddharth Cavale, Ananya Mariam Rajesh
articles.description: Target (TGT.N) on Wednesday forecast holiday-quarter profit largely above Wall Street expectations as the big-box retailer benefits from easing supply-chain costs and its efforts to control inventory start to pay off, sending its up 7% in premarket trading.
articles.title: Target forecasts strong holiday-quarter profit on lower inventory levels, supply-chain costs

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Berkshire Hathaway (BRKa.N) said it has shed its holdings in General Motors (GM.N), Johnson & Johnson (JNJ.N) and Procter & Gamble (PG.N), and trimmed its stake in Amazon.com (AMZN.O), as the conglomerate controlled by Warren Buffett boosted its cash pile to a record $157.2 billion.
articles.title: Berkshire sheds General Motors, Johnson & Johnson, Procter & Gamble as it builds cash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Euro zone banks are losing millions of euros due to tech contractors letting them down, the European Central Bank said on Wednesday, as it warned of shortcomings in how lenders approach cyber-risks more broadly.
articles.title: Euro zone banks lose millions of euros to poor IT outsourcing

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said it was carrying out an operation against Hamas in the Gaza Strip's Al Shifa hospital on Wednesday and urged all members of the militant group in the hospital to surrender.
articles.title: Israel raids Gaza's Al Shifa Hospital

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden meets Chinese leader Xi Jinping for the first time in a year on Wednesday, for talks that may ease friction between the adversarial superpowers on military conflicts, drug-trafficking and artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Biden, Xi meet as US-China military, economic tensions grind on

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski, Danielle Broadway, Lisa Richwine
articles.description: While Hollywood celebrates the end of strikes by writers and actors, the multibillion-dollar economic toll on everyone from crew members to caterers will take months to tally.
articles.title: Hollywood strikes sap economy as industry readies for revamp
